question: Which type of pressure doesn't require a reference
explanation: Absolute pressure is measured relative to a perfect vacuum and does not require a reference to another pressure.

question: ____is simply the measurement of one unknown pressure with reference to another unknown pressure
explanation: Differential pressure measures the difference between two unknown pressures, typically using a reference pressure.

question: Which of the following is correct about bourdon tube

options.a: When high pressures need to be measured, the tube is designed to be stiff
options.b: When low pressures need to be measured, the tube is designed to be stiff
options.c: capsules are more stiff than bourdon tube

explanation: A Bourdon tube is designed to be stiffer for high-pressure measurements to withstand the force without excessive deformation.

question: Which of the following is correct about Magnesyn

options.a: It uses permanent magnet for its rotors
options.b: It uses DC current as input
options.c: It uses electromagnet for its rotors

explanation: Magnesyn systems use a permanent magnet for their rotors, which interacts with the stator to transmit position data.

question: Why is remote indication system preferred for Fuel Pressure Indication System

options.a: It is not safe to run a fuel line into the cockpit

explanation: A remote indication system is preferred for fuel pressure to avoid running hazardous fuel lines into the cockpit, ensuring safety.

question: At what cabin altitude will a cabin altitude warning switch close
explanation: The cabin altitude warning switch typically closes at 10,000 ft. above mean sea level to alert the crew of potential pressurization issues.

question: Which type of sensor is most suited for differential pressure measurement
explanation: Diaphragms are most suited for differential pressure measurement due to their sensitivity to small pressure differences across two sides.

question: ____is a pressures being interpreted as power available at the engine propeller shaft
explanation: Manifold pressure is a measure of the pressure in the engine's intake manifold, directly related to the power available at the propeller shaft.

question: Which of the following is correct

options.a: The higher the pressure of the fuel air mixture going into the engine, the less power it can produce
options.b: The higher the pressure of the fuel air mixture going into the engine, the more power it can produce
options.c: The lower the pressure of the fuel air mixture going into the engine, the more power it can produce

explanation: Higher pressure of the fuel-air mixture in the engine (e.g., higher manifold pressure) results in more power output due to improved combustion efficiency.

question: The pressure sensor for Hydraulic Pressure Indication System is
explanation: A diaphragm is commonly used as the pressure sensor in hydraulic pressure indication systems due to its sensitivity and reliability for measuring fluid pressure.

question: Which of the following uses electro magnet as a rotor
explanation: Autosyn systems use an electromagnet as a rotor, energized by AC power, to transmit position data.

question: For an instrument with flange, the type of mounting used is
explanation: An instrument with a flange typically uses flange mounting, secured with screws and nuts directly to the panel.

question: The instruments which are included in a basic six grouping are

options.a: Vertical speed indicator, standby magnetic compass

explanation: The basic six grouping includes the airspeed indicator, altimeter, attitude indicator (gyro-horizon), heading indicator, turn coordinator, and vertical speed indicator.

question: Which of the following is DC synchro system
explanation: Micro-desynn is a DC synchro system used for precise position indication, typically in smaller instruments.

question: The instrument which are included in a basic six grouping are

options.b: Air speed indicator, standby magnetic compass

explanation: The basic six grouping includes the altimeter, airspeed indicator, attitude indicator, heading indicator (course indicator), turn coordinator, and vertical speed indicator.

question: How does the stator of a TX (Transmitter) of a synchro receive voltage

options.a: By a magnetic coupling with the rotor
options.b: By a physical connection with the rotor
options.c: By a magnetic coupling with another stator

explanation: The stator of a synchro transmitter (TX) receives voltage through magnetic coupling with the rotor, which induces an AC voltage in the stator windings.

question: Which of the following instrument is found on Wright Flyer of Wright Brothers
explanation: The Wright Flyer had a simple engine tachometer to monitor engine RPM, as it lacked advanced instruments like gyro horizons or primary flight displays.

question: What are the methods of instrument mounting on the panel is/are used
explanation: Instrument mounting methods include both flange mounting (using screws and nuts) and clamp mounting (using clamps to secure the instrument).

question: Which of the following instruments are designed to measure operating parameters of the aircraft's engine(s)
explanation: Power plant instruments, such as tachometers and oil pressure gauges, are designed to measure operating parameters of the aircraft's engines.

question: Which of the following instruments contribute information used by the pilot to guide the aircraft along a definite course

options.b: Engine Indication and Crew Alerting System

explanation: The horizontal situation display (e.g., HSI) provides navigation information to guide the aircraft along a definite course.

question: Where should power plant instruments be located

options.a: On the First Officer forward instrument panel
options.b: On the Captain forward instrument panel
options.c: At the center of the forward instrument panel visible to both pilots

explanation: Power plant instruments are placed at the center of the forward instrument panel to be visible to both pilots for effective monitoring.

question: ____serves to indicate the airspeed range over which the aircraft landing flaps may be extended in the take-off, approach and landing configurations of the aircraft
explanation: The white arc on an airspeed indicator shows the safe range for extending landing flaps during takeoff, approach, and landing.

question: Which of the following instrument is found on Wright Flyer of Wright Brothers
explanation: The Wright Flyer used an anemometer to measure airspeed, as it lacked modern instruments like navigation or primary flight displays.

question: What are the two major components of a synchro
explanation: A synchro system consists of a transmitter (TX) and a receiver (TR), which work together to transmit positional data.

question: What is the instrument mechanism system that combines all four elements of an instrument in a single case
explanation: A direct sensing instrument system integrates all four elements (detecting, measuring, coupling, and indicating) within a single case.

question: Which of the following uses permanent magnet as a rotor
explanation: Magnasyn systems use a permanent magnet as a rotor to transmit position data via magnetic coupling.

question: What is the instrument mechanism system that has elements of an instrument in a separate location
explanation: A remote sensing instrument system has its elements (e.g., sensor and indicator) in separate locations, connected electrically or mechanically.

question: Which of the following elements of an instrument senses changes in value of the physical quantity or condition presented to it
explanation: The detecting element senses changes in the physical quantity or condition, such as pressure or temperature, in an instrument system.

question: Flange type instrument mounting has
explanation: Flange-type instrument mounting typically uses a front-end design, secured with screws to the front of the instrument panel.

question: Which of the following is AC synchro system
explanation: Differential synchro systems operate with AC power, used to transmit angular position differences between two synchros.
